div.h2:
The Technological Revolution by
Sylvain Rochon
div.p:
Date: Thursday, September 19, 2013
Time:
9:00 am - 10:15 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: Technology is changing so fast not only people aren’t ready with what is being developed in laboratories around the world, but current commercialization paradigms can’t keep up either. In order to build success for the present and future, we must be able to plan with how the world will change over the next 2, 5 or even 10 years. Being an entrepreneur means attempting to be in front of the wave. How can you be if you don’t know what’s coming?
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TechnologicalRevolution > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Have a better understanding of trends in technology, how they will impact our daily lives and how it will affect business in general

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TechnologicalRevolution > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Look at his/her current projects and career with fresh eyes

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TechnologicalRevolution > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: Gain the ability to direct their professional path in line with the technological trends

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p1

p.ui:msg: Sylvain Rochon is a bachelor’s degree graduate in Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering and Education from the University of Ottawa who, 10 years ago, has turned to entrepreneurship in order to help change the world for the better.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p2

p.ui:msg: In 2005, Sylvain started Sylien Games, an online multiplayer games development (web and smartdevice games) corporation, and since then it has grown from zero to 142 titles published on multiple platforms.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p3

p.ui:msg: An avid entrepreneur with 15 years’ experience consulting and teaching on emotional intelligence, the future, and entrepreneurship, Sylvain has helped many young entrepreneurs successfully start their own businesses by developing the individuals into masters of their ownself. Sylvain also sits on multiple advisory boards such as the Interactive Multimedia & Design program at University Carleton and Algonquin College, The Ottawa Network (10 000+ members) and JCI Ottawa.

div.h2:
Place aux jeunes en région et la francophonie canadienne by
Mathieu Vigneault
div.p:
Date: Thursday, September 19, 2013
Time:
10:30 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
French only

p.ui:msg: L’objectif de cette conférence est de présenter l’organisation Place aux jeunes en région (PAJR) qui contribue avec succès à favoriser la migration des jeunes vers les régions du Québec depuis plus de deux décennies. Interpelée en cours de route par plusieurs organismes de la francophonie canadienne, et même mondiale, PAJR dresse le bilan de ses actions et donne un aperçu de ses orientations.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Mathieu Vigneault > p1

p.ui:msg: Détenteur d’une maîtrise en interventions régionales, d’une maîtrise en gestion et d’un diplôme de deuxième cycle en gestion de l’innovation, R. Mathieu Vigneault œuvre dans le domaine du développement socioéconomique depuis près de quinze ans. D’abord à l’emploi d’une MRC, puis d’un CLD en Beauce, sa région natale, M. Vigneault a ensuite occupé, de 2005 à 2012, le poste de directeur général du CLD de la région d’Acton, en Montérégie, avant d’accepter la direction du réseau national de Place aux jeunes en région.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Mathieu Vigneault > p2

p.ui:msg: Depuis le début de sa carrière, M. Vigneault a publié plusieurs articles et donner plusieurs conférences portant principalement sur le développement économique et territorial ainsi que sur l’entrepreneuriat. En cours de route, son dynamisme et son caractère innovant lui ont valu d’être reconnu par ses pairs à trois reprises : Relève du développement économique 2006 (Association des professionnels en développement économique du Québec (APDEQ)), Précurseur en développement économique 2010 (APDEQ) et à titre de CLD de l’année 2010 (Association des CLD du Québec).

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Mathieu Vigneault > p3

p.ui:msg: Au cours des dernières années, les champs d’intérêt de M. Vigneault se sont plus particulièrement portés sur les enjeux et défis de l’entreprise du 21e siècle, sur l’occupation du territoire, ainsi que sur la migration des jeunes et de la main-d’œuvre dans son ensemble.

div.h2:
Effective Presentation/Pub Speaking Skills by
Margie Hibbard
div.p:
Date: Thursday, September 19, 2013
Time:
1:45 pm - 3:00 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: Take the panic out of public speaking! The goal of this session is to help increase your confidence speaking and improve the effectiveness of your presentations.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > EffectivePresentationPub > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Learn techniques to channel nervous energy

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > EffectivePresentationPub > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Know how to prepare for a presentation

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > EffectivePresentationPub > ul > li3
Program > Content > Bio > Margie Hibbard > p1

p.ui:msg: Margie Hibbard, HBComm has been a member of JCI since 2003 and is Certified Local Trainer. She is currently a stay at home mom and enjoys every minute with her two toddlers Connor and Grace. In her spare time, she provides customized training in leadership, computer skills, and wine sales systems through her company AMAK Solutions, founded 2007. In JCI, she has held multiple executive positions, including local President, JCI Penticton and President, JCI BC/Yukon Region

div.p:
Date: Thursday, September 19, 2013
Time:
3:15 pm - 4:30 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: What holds an organization back from raising money? How does an organization become financially secure? How then does that organization remain financially sound?In this course Joey Hoechsmann will discuss how to improve an organization’s fundraising efforts. He will cover three revenue streams including events, sponsorship and gifts & grants. Joey uses real JCI experiences and examples to help participants gain the knowledge to raise more money for their organization.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Joey Hoechsmann > p1

p.ui:msg: Senator Joey Hoechsmann has been a JCI member since 2004 and held numerous positions in JCI including Chapter President, Regional President and National Vice President. He owns and operates three furniture and mattress retail stores in Cranbrook BC. He believes strongly in continuous personal and proffessional improvement and spends several hours a week in his business coaching and training his staff to be more effective at exceeding customer's needs. Joey shares his life with his bride Christine and has two energetic boys, Brendon and Eli. He enjoys living in the Kootenays and all the outdoor activities the area offers including skiing, sledding, mountain biking, and hiking. He credits JCI for much of his success in business and has build lifelong friendships through the organization.

div.p:
Date: Thursday, September 19, 2013
Time:
9:00 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: JCI Impact is a course aimed for JCI members who want to become active citizens and make long lasting positive changes in their communities. The course discusses the active citizenship concept, covers the analysis of community needs, the establishment of the real causes of problems and discusses the projects a Local Organization can conduct with other partners in order to create long lasting and definite positive changes in the community.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Brian Kavanaugh > p1

p.ui:msg: Brian Kavanaugh is a Senior Desktop Application Developer and President at Nebraska Jaycee Foundation. In the past years, he was 2010 US Chamber of Commerce Liaison at United States Junior Chamber, 2009 National Vice President at United States Junior Chamber and 2008 Vice President at Junior Chamber International (JCI).

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Brian Kavanaugh > p2

p.ui:msg: Head trainer for JCI's official courses JCI Achieve (local organization development), JCI Admin (local organization management), JCI CSR (corporate social responsibility - the responsibility of the active citizen), JCI Networking, JCI Presenter (effective presentations) and JCI Trainer (planning and delivering adult learning courses), plus several courses of his own. He has trained in various countries in western Europe, in Canada and throughout the United States.

div.p:
Date: Thursday, September 19, 2013
Time:
1:45 pm - 4:30 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: JCI Achieve, the JCI Local Organization Development Course is a full day course that uses discussions and case studies to understand and establish the local organization’s identity, its purpose and what to do to accomplish JCI’s Mission, effectively adopt and use recognizable and appreciated activities, understand the existing demographic groups and their characteristics and how to build an attractive organization that will bring in new members who are looking for the development opportunities and want to create positive change as active citizens.
JCI Achieve should be taken by all members who want to fully understand the meaning, purpose and dynamics of building an attractive JCI local organization.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Brian Kavanaugh > p1

p.ui:msg: Brian Kavanaugh is a Senior Desktop Application Developer and President at Nebraska Jaycee Foundation. In the past years, he was 2010 US Chamber of Commerce Liaison at United States Junior Chamber, 2009 National Vice President at United States Junior Chamber and 2008 Vice President at Junior Chamber International (JCI).

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Brian Kavanaugh > p2

p.ui:msg: Head trainer for JCI's official courses JCI Achieve (local organization development), JCI Admin (local organization management), JCI CSR (corporate social responsibility - the responsibility of the active citizen), JCI Networking, JCI Presenter (effective presentations) and JCI Trainer (planning and delivering adult learning courses), plus several courses of his own. He has trained in various countries in western Europe, in Canada and throughout the United States.

div.h2:
Succeed your business in emerging markets by
Dr. Zhan Su
div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
12:00 am - 1:30 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual

p.ui:msg: The rise of emerging markets is radically changing our business environment. However, the emergence of these countries should not simply be reduced to the arrival of hard competitors, it also represents an incredible window of opportunities for Canadian and Quebec businesses to thrive and expand internationally. Emerging countries being heterogeneous and complex, a comprehensive knowledge of these new players now appears more as a necessity rather than a simple asset in leading the activities of your company in the future.

What is the actual and potential economic importance of emerging countries in the world? What are the characteristics of the business environment in these countries? What are the key success factors for business in emerging markets? These are the topics that will be discussed at the conference.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Dr. Zhan Su > p1

p.ui:msg: Dr. Zhan Su is Professor of Business Strategy and International Management and Director of Stephen-A.-Jarislowsky Chair in International Business at Laval University. He received his Bachelor of Engineering in China in 1982 and his Doctorate in Business Administration in France in 1990. During these past years, Professor Su has carried out many research projects regarding a variety of subjects and published in numerous journals and books.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Dr. Zhan Su > p2

p.ui:msg: He has also organized many training programs for executives and provided consultation for numerous organizations and firms worldwide. He received the Leaders in Business Education Award from PriceWaterHouseCoopers and the National Post of Canada in 2001 and the Laval University Award for Excellence in Teaching in 1999.

div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
3:30 pm - 4:00 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room AB
Dress code:
Business Casual

p.ui:msg: All you wanted to know about the life of a world president!

h2.ui:msg: Effective speaking presented by Stephen-A.-Jarislowsky Chair

div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
1:45 pm - 3:00 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room AB
Dress code:
Business Casual

p.ui:msg: JCI Canada runs an Effective Speaking Competition each year at national convention. During the year chapters run an Effective Speaking Course to prepare their members for the national competition. Each region runs a regional competition and the regional winners proceed on to the national level of the competition.

The winner of the National Effective Speaking Competition represents JCI Canada at the speaking competition held at the Conference of the Americas. The winner from the Conference of the Americas competition proceeds on to the world level competition held at World Congress.

Every entry in the speaking competition is required to be longer than five (5) minutes but no more than seven (7) minutes. Candidates shall be judged on the basis of content, delivery and language by at least three (3) . Also, candidates may speak in any of the JCI correspondent languages; english, french, spanish, or japanese.

The winner of the 2012 Effective Speaking Competition held at the 2012 National Convention & Annual General Meeting in Kimberley, British Columbia was Erin Guillemette of JCI Durham, speaking on
A Leader Is...
Erin will represent JCI Canada at the Conference of the Americas in May 2013.

9:00 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur

Room C

Business Casual

div.h2:
Business Startup Magic by
Sylvain Rochon
div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
9:00 am - 10:15 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: Business Startup Magic: how to take your idea from zero to success without raising funds

An entrepreneur’s first instinct when starting their first venture is to raise funds. The truth is, more than 91% of successful businesses succeed without raising any funds. Why? Together, we’ll explore the answer to this question by examining methods of getting a new business started without any funds whatsoever. We’ll use some case studies to illustrate.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > BusinessStartupMagic > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Learn some tricks in starting new businesses with no funds

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > BusinessStartupMagic > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Learn when funds can easily made available and beneficial for an enterprise

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > BusinessStartupMagic > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: Identify ideas they may wish to capture as a business that will generate revenues quickly

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p1

p.ui:msg: Sylvain Rochon is a bachelor’s degree graduate in Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering and Education from the University of Ottawa who, 10 years ago, has turned to entrepreneurship in order to help change the world for the better.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p2

p.ui:msg: In 2005, Sylvain started Sylien Games, an online multiplayer games development (web and smartdevice games) corporation, and since then it has grown from zero to 142 titles published on multiple platforms.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p3

p.ui:msg: An avid entrepreneur with 15 years’ experience consulting and teaching on emotional intelligence, the future, and entrepreneurship, Sylvain has helped many young entrepreneurs successfully start their own businesses by developing the individuals into masters of their ownself. Sylvain also sits on multiple advisory boards such as the Interactive Multimedia & Design program at University Carleton and Algonquin College, The Ottawa Network (10 000+ members) and JCI Ottawa.

div.h2:
The Positive Power of Critical Thinking in the Workplace by
Jann Vandermeulen
div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
10:30 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: The goal of this session is to understand what critical thinking is and how it can help you make more objective decisions and defend them. Strong critical thinking skills can help minimize decision-making biases and gain credibility.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > PositivePowerOf > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Define critical thinking and discuss its importance in work environments

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > PositivePowerOf > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Prepare and explain the possible unconscious influences to our thinking

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > PositivePowerOf > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: Recognize statements that contain faulty arguments

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > PositivePowerOf > ul > li4

li.ui:msg: Apply critical thinking techniques to problem solving and decision making

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Jann Vandermeulen > p1

p.ui:msg: Jann Vandermeulen, M.A., (C)OACCPP, CTP is a bilingual (English/French) cognitive behavioural therapist who has worked with over 5 000 clients.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Jann Vandermeulen > p2

p.ui:msg: He earned his Master of Arts in Forensic Psychology from the John Jay College of Criminal Justice at the City University of New York and his Bachelor of Arts from Bishop’s University. He is a Certified Member of the Ontario Association of Consultants Counsellors Psychometrists and Psychotherapists, a Certified Training Practitioner with the Canadian Society for Training and Development and a member of the Academy of Cognitive Therapy. Jann is also a Past President of JCI Toronto and JCI Central Region.

div.h2:
Think Green, Plant a Tree and Make Money by
Hernando Gomez
div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
9:00 am - 10:15 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: You want to make a difference in this world, whether it’s through community service, leading a team or making the world a better place to live, you still have room to make a positive impact. Now you have the opportunity to shape the world while making money. This seminar will help you rethink the investment world in a green way. With a practical, hands-on guide you’ll learn the smart way to become a socially responsible investor while remaining true to your values. Let’s plant some “trees” and relax while our money grows.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > ThinkGreenPlantTree > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Find out ways to become an active socially responsible investor

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > ThinkGreenPlantTree > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Learn how to invest in green sustainable opportunities

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > ThinkGreenPlantTree > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: Make your investment a new alternative for helping the planet

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Hernando Gomez > p1

p.ui:msg: Hernando Gomez is a senior manager in the Management Advisory Services Department at MBAF. Since 1997, he has focused his practice in business valuations, corporate finance, debt management, financial modeling and litigation support for various industries including automotive dealerships, construction, family limited partnerships, investment, manufacturing, professional services, real estate, retail, technology, utilities and wholesale/distribution.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Hernando Gomez > p2

p.ui:msg: Hernando has traveled extensively delivering business valuation and other business/management-related seminars in 15+ countries worldwide. He has been invited as an international trainer to national and international events in the United States, Latin America, Europe, UAE and Asia.

div.p:
Date: Friday, September 20, 2013
Time:
10:30 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual

Dress code:
Business

p.ui:msg: Come enjoy with us a special evening for the JCI awards night on Thursday September 19, 2013 at Le Parlementaire. Located at the National Assembly of Québec, the parliament building is imposing with its four wings forming a square roughly 100m on each side. The eloquent architecture and interior decoration offer a veritable fresco of Québec history. Witness to parliamentary social life, host of numerous State Dinners and formal receptions and venue par excellence for Québec products, Le Parlementaire is unique among the region’s restaurants.
The JCI Quebec team is awaiting for this formal evening in a unique setting.
Le Parlementaire, the best kept secret of Quebec City!
Presented by Deloitte, in collaboration with QVC-Inscript.
Awards:

li.ui:msg: Best local growth and development program
Most improved JCI organization of the year
Executive committee member of the year

p.ui:msg: From 11:00

8:00 am - 9:00 am

div.h2:
Determined against all odds by
Josée Masson
div.p:
Date: Saturday, September 21, 2013
Time:
12:00 am - 1:30 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room AB
Dress code:
Business Casual

p.ui:msg: No description yet

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Josée Masson > p1

p.ui:msg: Josée Masson, a social worker, has worked in the public sector for 13 years before being founder and head of Deuil-Jeunesse, whose mission is to support, inform and act in connection with the serious illness of a loved one or bereavement lived in childhood and adolescence. Her group "L'Arc-en-Ciel" was awarded the Simone-Paré from Laval University in 2004. Since then, she has developed a professional team, many other innovative services for young people aged between 3 and 20 years. In 2007, she earned a tribute price of the Quebec Bar.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Josée Masson > p2

p.ui:msg: Lecturer at the Université Laval, speaker and trainer, she travels the regions to raise awareness of the importance of providing support to these young people. She collaborates with many organizations including Québec-Transplant, the Quebec Association of Suicide Prevention, is the Ambassador of the Corporation des thanatologues du Quebec and is regularly invited to share his expertise in the Quebec media. She is the author of "Derrière mes larmes d'enfant" published in 2006, but completely revised to read "Mort, mais pas dans mon cœur" released in 2010. In 2012, she was named Young personality business sector "Non-profit, community and social order" and "Person of the Year" by the Junior Chamber of Commerce of Quebec.

h2.ui:msg: JCI Canada President Gala presented by Lavery, in collaboration with Dx Design.

div.p:
Date: Saturday, September 21, 2013
Time:
6:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Ballroom (ABC)
Dress code:
Formal

p.ui:msg: Join the JCI Canada community for the presentation of the 78th JCI Canada President Gala on Saturday September 21 that will held this year at the TRYP hotel PUR in Quebec City.

In the heart of the revitalized Saint Roch historic district and steps from the fortified Old City, TRYP Hotel PUR puts you near Quebec City’s technology neighborhood. This urban hotel, with its unrivalled unique services, has reinvented the hotel experience in Quebec City!
Another great opportunity to meet young professionals and entrepreneurs that are impacting communities throughout Canada.
Come join us for this special evening to close our 78th JCI Canada National Convention.

Time:
9:00 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur

1:45 pm - 3:00 pm

9:00 am - 10:15 am

TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur

Room G

Business Casual

English only

p.ui:msg: Using your own thinking to change the world

The objective of this session is to train the attendees on how to create success in our professional and personal lives through the power of our brain. In order to do this, the attendee will learn to understand how the brain works, how much we actually have control over what we think, how we think, and ultimately how these impact how we live our lives. Ultimately, the goal is to generate success through self-training techniques.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TransformativeThinking > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Understand the biological basics of learning and how the brain works

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TransformativeThinking > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Understand the impact of their own thinking on the world around them

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TransformativeThinking > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: Become empowered and gain the ability to change how their perceive the world

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p1

p.ui:msg: Sylvain Rochon is a bachelor’s degree graduate in Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering and Education from the University of Ottawa who, 10 years ago, has turned to entrepreneurship in order to help change the world for the better.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p2

p.ui:msg: In 2005, Sylvain started Sylien Games, an online multiplayer games development (web and smartdevice games) corporation, and since then it has grown from zero to 142 titles published on multiple platforms.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Sylvain Rochon > p3

p.ui:msg: An avid entrepreneur with 15 years’ experience consulting and teaching on emotional intelligence, the future, and entrepreneurship, Sylvain has helped many young entrepreneurs successfully start their own businesses by developing the individuals into masters of their ownself. Sylvain also sits on multiple advisory boards such as the Interactive Multimedia & Design program at University Carleton and Algonquin College, The Ottawa Network (10 000+ members) and JCI Ottawa.

div.h2:
Tune up your Work/Life Balance by
Jann Vandermeulen
div.p:
Date: Saturday, September 21, 2013
Time:
10:30 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room G
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: The goal of this session is to help you identify, break down and cope with possible stressors that affect the balance of your personal, family, work and JCI life. Better stress management strategies can have a positive impact on your physical health, relationships and work performance.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TuneUpWorkLife > ul > li1
Program > Content > Training > TuneUpWorkLife > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Identify possible stressors at work that can affect the personal life and vice versa

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > TuneUpWorkLife > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: List and apply techniques to help cope with stress

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Jann Vandermeulen > p1

p.ui:msg: Jann Vandermeulen, M.A., (C)OACCPP, CTP is a bilingual (English/French) cognitive behavioural therapist who has worked with over 5 000 clients.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Jann Vandermeulen > p2

p.ui:msg: He earned his Master of Arts in Forensic Psychology from the John Jay College of Criminal Justice at the City University of New York and his Bachelor of Arts from Bishop’s University. He is a Certified Member of the Ontario Association of Consultants Counsellors Psychometrists and Psychotherapists, a Certified Training Practitioner with the Canadian Society for Training and Development and a member of the Academy of Cognitive Therapy. Jann is also a Past President of JCI Toronto and JCI Central Region.

div.h2:
What language do you speak? by
Hernando Gomez
div.p:
Date: Saturday, September 21, 2013
Time:
9:00 am - 10:15 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: Speaking the same language does not guarantee that we can communicate to each other effectively. Success comes from more than just having an expertise in a field or discipline.

It also comes from being able to express that expertise and to really understand the needs of others. In modern era, ways to communicate have increased exponentially. However, the essence of communication remains a challenge. No matter what role you play in life, whether you’re a leader, a team member, or a professional, effective and clear communication is imperative to your success.
After this session, the learner will be expected to:

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > LanguageYouSpeak > ul > li1

li.ui:msg: Learn key steps to communicate effectively

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > LanguageYouSpeak > ul > li2

li.ui:msg: Explore new ways to improve your verbal and non-verbal communication skills

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Training > LanguageYouSpeak > ul > li3

li.ui:msg: Identify creative ways to use communication tools to solve conflicts

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Hernando Gomez > p1

p.ui:msg: Hernando Gomez is a senior manager in the Management Advisory Services Department at MBAF. Since 1997, he has focused his practice in business valuations, corporate finance, debt management, financial modeling and litigation support for various industries including automotive dealerships, construction, family limited partnerships, investment, manufacturing, professional services, real estate, retail, technology, utilities and wholesale/distribution.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Hernando Gomez > p2

p.ui:msg: Hernando has traveled extensively delivering business valuation and other business/management-related seminars in 15+ countries worldwide. He has been invited as an international trainer to national and international events in the United States, Latin America, Europe, UAE and Asia.

div.h2:
Agile Projects Across the Enterprise by
Christian Goudreau
div.p:
Date: Saturday, September 21, 2013
Time:
10:30 am - 11:45 am
Venue:
TRYP Quebec Hotel Pur
Room:
Room H
Dress code:
Business Casual
Language:
English only

p.ui:msg: For over a decade, a movement has gathered momentum, releasing software engineers from inadequate, outdated ways of managing projects. After many painful decades, it became clear that earlier project management methods did not apply to the craft of software engineering. Lightweight iterative practices began displacing older models, until 66 years after John von Neumann conceived of the stored-program computer, the Agile Manifesto was declared.

BUT, Agile methodologies aren’t just for IT anymore. Used effectively, the feedback-driven practices of Agile can boost speed and enhance execution for all kinds of projects. This conference explores how. It invites you to join the growing conversation about Agile across the enterprise. Agile methodologies can bring new efficiencies in every domain of organizational life.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Christian Goudreau > p1

p.ui:msg: A young entrepreneur with a passion for new technologies, Christian Goudreau mans the helm at ArcBees, a company that has been specializing in the development of high performance and high quality web applications since it was founded in 2010. The Quebec City-based firm takes pride in the fact that it can count on renowned clients from all over the world.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Christian Goudreau > p2

p.ui:msg: ArcBees was launched following the creation of GWT-platform, based on the Google Web Toolkit (GWT), which is now used by tens of thousands of developers worldwide to facilitate the development of web applications. Moreover, at the age of just 29, Christian was appointed to the GWT Steering Committee.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Christian Goudreau > p3

p.ui:msg: A talented guest speaker, his services are much sought-after, not only in Quebec but also in Europe and the United States, where he takes great pleasure in sharing his technical knowledge and his passion for business.

ui:msg.description: Program > Content > Bio > Christian Goudreau > p4

p.ui:msg: Christian is an inspiring communicator and in 2012 won an award at the Jeune personnalité d’affaires Banque Nationale competition organized by the Jeune chambre de commerce de Québec (JCCQ) in the “Technology and Research” category.

p.ui:msg: Discover Quebec city the way it’s very founders did it. The boat cruise on St-Lawrence river will show you to the most beautiful sites of the city, its very own Château Frontenac, our magnificent waterfall along with numerous others attractions. Louis Jolliet himself awaits you!

In addition, Place Ste-Foy, in collaboration with Simons, is pleased to provide the 50 first JCI members a gift card valued at $ 25 each to spend at Simons.

Do not register if you’ve experienced vertigo in the past.
